Package it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std

Standard implementation of bigraphs with abstract internal names but concrete interfaces.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Child
    Place graph entities are organised in tree-like structures.
    Edge
    Edges are handles not accessible through the outer interface on the contrary of outer names (OuterName).
    Handle
    Handles are link entities identifying the hyper-edges that compose link graphs and that link points.
    InnerName
    Inner names are points accessible through the inner interface (whereas ports are not) identified by their name (cf.
    LinkEntity
    Describes entities composing the link graph such as handles (Handle) and points (Point).
    LinkFacet
    Link facets are the components of link graph inner and outer interfaces and are names specialised in inner and outer ones (cf.
    Node
    Describes nodes of bigraphs with abstract internal names.
    OuterName
    Outer names are handles accessible through the outer interface (whereas edges are not) identified by their name (cf.
    Parent
    Place graph entities are organised in tree-like structures.
    PlaceEntity
    Describes entities composing the place graph such as roots (Root), nodes (Node), and sites (Site).
    Point
    Points are link entities connected by the hyper-edges composing the link graphs.
    Port
    Ports are end-points for hyper-edges composing the link graphs and are exposed by nodes structured in the place graph composing the bigraph together with the aforementioned link graph.
    Root
    Roots describe regions of the bigraph.
    Site
    Sites are leaves in the place graph structure and compose its inner interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AgentMatch
    Objects created from this class are particular matches for bigraphs with abstract internal names where the bigraph where the redex has to be matched is ground (its inner interface is empty, hence it is an agent) whereas the redex can be any bigraph over the same signature.
    AgentMatcher
    Provides services for computing the matches a bigraph (with abstract internal names) into a ground one; matches are described by AgentMatch.
    AgentRewritingRule
    This class specialises RewritingRule for ground bigraphs i.e.
    Bigraph
    Objects created from this class are bigraphs with abstract internal names (i.e.
    BigraphBuilder
    This class provides services for the creation and manipulation of bigraphs since instances of Bigraph are immutable.
    Control
    Objects created from this class are bigraphical controls describing the modality (i.e. active or passive) and the arity (i.e. the number of ports) of nodes decorated with it.
    InstantiationMap
    Objects created from this class are instantiation rules for bigraphs which are maps from the reactum sites to the redex ones describing how parameters (for the fixed width) are instantiated.
    Match
    Objects created from this class are matches for bigraphs with abstract internal names.
    Matcher
    Provides services for computing matches of bigraphs with abstract internal names; matches are described by Match.
    NodeChaser
    Objects created from this class can be used to keep trace of nodes and their replicas.
    RewritingRule
    A rewriting rule is a reaction rule described by means of rewrites i.e. the reaction is a substitution of an occurrence (in the bigraph to which the rule is applied) of the rule's redex with the rule's reactum.
    Signature
    Objects created from this class are bigraphical dynamic signatures.A signature defines the controls that can be assigned to the nodes of bigraphs over it.
    SignatureBuilder
    The class provides methods for signature construction since Signature is immutable.
    WeightedMatch
    Objects created from this class are weighted matches for bigraphs with abstract internal names.
    WeightedMatcher
    Provides services for computing optimal matches of bigraphs with abstract internal names; matches are described by Match.

Package it.uniud.mads.jlibbig.core.std Description

Standard implementation of bigraphs with abstract internal names but concrete interfaces. This reflects on nodes and edges identity being instance based instead of name based. As a consequence, operations like bigraph composition and juxtaposition are defined whenever the operands have compatible interfaces.
